query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Short title: Semantically enhanced multi-viewer that embeds a newly developed TVB 3D viewer
result.description: Full title A semantically enhanced multiviewer that embeds a newly developed TVB 3D viewer that allows for integration of personalized 3D coordinates with knowledge about pathways and mechanisms in situ The deliverable for this task is a joint highranking journal publication of the teams building this environment

result.title: SOP for immune monitoring of patient samples
result.description: immune monitoring of peripheral blood and bone marrow samples taken from the patients enrolled in the clinical trial described in this proposal are of utmost importance. Blood samples and if possible bone marrow samples will be drawn from the patients before the infusion of the multivirus- specific T-cell product and at different time-points afterwards. The presence of T cells directed against the targeted viruses (e.g. CMV, EBV and AdV) will be analysed by multi-colour flow cytometry using HLA/peptide multimers for known immunodominant viral epitopes combined with antibodies for different T-cell phenotypes (central memory, effector memory, memory stem T cells or effector T cells). Also restimulation experiments with viral peptide pools, followed by counterstaining with CD4/8 antibodies and staining for specific activation markers (CD137, CD154) and/or relevant cytokines (IFNγ, IL-4, GM-CSF) will be used.

project.title: Transfer of multivirus-specific T-cells following transplantation

result.title: Final report on the DL accelerator design
result.description: In this report we will describe the design and evaluation of the four DL accelerators: heterogeneous, reconfigurable, dynamically reconfigurable, and co-design. A comparison across the different designs will be discussed (T3.3 - T3.5).
